content:
RepairTask RepairTask Class

Definition

Namespace:
System.Fabric.Repair
Assembly:
System.Fabric.dll

Represents a repair task, which includes information about what kind of repair was requested, what its progress is, and what its final result was.

This class supports the Service Fabric platform; it is not meant to be called directly from your code.

Edit

In this Article

A description of the purpose or other informational details of the repair task.

Value
String String

The name of the repair executor.

ExecutorData ExecutorData

Edit

Gets or sets a data string that the repair executor can use to store its internal state.

public string ExecutorData { get; set; }Public Property ExecutorData As String
Value
String String

A data string that the repair executor can use to store its internal state.

Flags Flags

Edit

Gets the flags that give additional details about the status of the repair task.

public RepairTaskFlags Flags { get; }Public ReadOnly Property Flags As RepairTaskFlags
Value
RepairTaskFlags RepairTaskFlags

The flags that give additional details about the status of the repair task.

Impact Impact

Edit

Gets an object that describes the impact of the repair.

public RepairImpactDescription Impact { get; set; }Public Property Impact As RepairImpactDescription
Value
RepairImpactDescription RepairImpactDescription

A RepairImpactDescription object that describes the impact of the repair.

Remarks

Impact must be specified by the repair executor upon transitioning to the Preparing state. The impact object determines what actions the system will take to prepare for the impact of the repair, prior to approving execution of the repair.

Edit

Gets or sets a value to determine if health checks have to be performed when the repair task enters the Preparing state.

public bool PerformPreparingHealthCheck { get; set; }Public Property PerformPreparingHealthCheck As Boolean
Value
Boolean Boolean

A value to determine if health checks have to be performed when the repair task enters the Preparing state.

Edit

Gets or sets a value to determine if health checks have to be performed when the repair task enters the Restoring state.

public bool PerformRestoringHealthCheck { get; set; }Public Property PerformRestoringHealthCheck As Boolean

A value to determine if health checks have to be performed when the repair task enters the Restoring state.

RepairTaskHealthCheckState RepairTaskHealthCheckState

Nullable<DateTime> Nullable(Of DateTime)

Value
Nullable<DateTime> Nullable(Of DateTime)

The time when the repair task entered the Restoring state.

ResultCode ResultCode

Edit

Gets or sets a value providing additional details about the result of the repair task execution.

public int ResultCode { get; set; }Public Property ResultCode As Integer
Value
Int32 Int32

A value providing additional details about the result of the repair task execution.

Remarks

This value should be an HRESULT.

ResultDetails ResultDetails

Edit

Gets or sets a string providing additional details about the result of the repair task execution.

public string ResultDetails { get; set; }Public Property ResultDetails As String
Value
String String

A string providing additional details about the result of the repair task execution.

ResultStatus ResultStatus

Edit

Gets or sets a value describing the overall result of the repair task execution.

public RepairTaskResult ResultStatus { get; set; }Public Property ResultStatus As RepairTaskResult
Value
RepairTaskResult RepairTaskResult

A RepairTaskResult value describing the overall result of the repair task execution.

Scope Scope

Edit

Gets an object describing the scope of the repair task.

public RepairScopeIdentifier Scope { get; }Public ReadOnly Property Scope As RepairScopeIdentifier
Value
RepairScopeIdentifier RepairScopeIdentifier

A RepairScopeIdentifier object describing the scope of the repair task.

Remarks

The repair task scope determines the resource against which access checks are performed when the repair task is created, modified, deleted, or retrieved. Entities impacted by a repair must be contained within the scope of the repair task. For example, repairs which impact nodes require that the repair task be created under the Cluster scope.

State State

Edit

Gets or sets the workflow state of the repair task.

public RepairTaskState State { get; set; }Public Property State As RepairTaskState
Value
RepairTaskState RepairTaskState

The workflow state of the repair task.

Target Target

Edit

Gets or sets an object describing which entities the requested repair action is targeting.

public RepairTargetDescription Target { get; set; }Public Property Target As RepairTargetDescription
Value
RepairTargetDescription RepairTargetDescription

An object describing which entities the requested repair action is targeting.

Remarks

Target may be null if the repair action does not require information about specific targets.

TaskId TaskId

Edit

Gets the identifier of the repair task.

public string TaskId { get; }Public ReadOnly Property TaskId As String
Value
String String

The identifier of the repair task.

Version Version

Edit

Gets or sets the version of the repair task.

public long Version { get; set; }Public Property Version As Long
Value
Int64 Int64

The version of the repair task.

Remarks

When creating a new repair task, the version must be set to zero. When updating a repair task via the UpdateRepairExecutionStateAsync method, the version is used for optimistic concurrency checks. If the version is set to zero, the update will not check for write conflicts. If the version is set to a non-zero value, then the update will only succeed if the actual current version of the repair task matches this value.
